intro: Antirhea borbonica var. duplidivisa, commonly known as the double-lobed antirhea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, large, and showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral structure, which features two distinct lobes, giving it its common name.
